refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para:
The sag file format is used by the
vfplot 1
program for representing vector fields defined on a grid.
The format is plain ASCII and consists of a single header line followed by a number of data lines

The header line describes the file and the grid it represents. It begins with the magic number #sag, then the file format version (this document describes version 1), the dimensions of the grid, and of the vectors; then the minimum and maximum of the first grid dimension, then of the second and so on; then the number of samples in the first dimension, then of the second dimension, and so on; finally the tolerance.
A data line consists of the grid coordinates and the vector components, separated by whitespace

The data lines are not required to be in any particular order, and there may be no data for some or all of the grid points. When being read, a data line is associated with a grid point if its position is a distance less than the tolerance specified in the header. When there is no such grid point the data line is discarded.
